results.title: Passing era of the steam horse [B&W]
results.brief_description: Steam locomotives have been replaced by diesels on the Victorian Railways. Their history in the system is briefly covered, and various types are shown in operation, concluding with the narrow gauge service from Ferntree Gully to Gembrook being restored as a tourist feature.

results.title: Pass it on
results.brief_description: Points out the importance of understanding good communication and the propoer functioning of organizations, using the child’s game wherein one person passes information on the the next person and continues down the line. The theme is mis-communication in the workplace.

results.title: Pas de deux
results.brief_description: Norman McLaren takes a look at the choreography of ballet, with cinema effects that are all you would expect from this master of improvisation in music and illustration. By exposing the same frames as many as ten times, the artist creates a multiple image of the ballerina and her partner (Margaret Mercier and Vincent Warren). A bare, black stage and back-lit figures, plus the remote, airy music of panpipes, produce a quiet and detachment similar to that of another McLaren film, “Lines”. Music by The United Folk Orchestra of Romania. (Seventeen awards, including Toronto; London; New York; Melbourne; Oscar nomination, Hollywood).

results.title: Partners: Eastern Africa
results.brief_description: A study of how the presence of the white man in East Africa has opened up possibilities for trade and industry from white the native population of East Africa should benefit; the film stresses the importance of improved medical, agriculture, educational, and industrial facilities and methods.

results.title: Parkville
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A lyrical look at this small historical, Melbourne suburb. Parkville is characterised by Victorian mansions, terraced houses, cast iron, park railings and ivy-clad columns. Social life is carried on in the wide streets, parklands and pubs. An atmospheric film of beautiful images featuring background low-key guitar music. Made by the students of Swinburne with the assistance of the Parkville Association.

results.title: Park here
results.creator_credit: John Eldridge, Ralph Keene and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: This film gives an account of the proposed scheme for national parks in Great Britain. In congested areas where there is insufficient open space for recreation, damage is often done because both children and adults need recreation, and take it al the expense of, for instance, some farmer’s property. Plans for the proposed beauty spots and parks to be reserved include places in the Lakes District, North Wales, Dartmoor, South Downs, Dovedale, Pembrokeshire Coast and Grassholm

results.title: Paris: la belle epoque
results.creator_credit: Edward Milner, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: An excursion through Paris, starting at the present day and then going through the period from the 1880’s to 1914. Consists of a montage of paintings by contemporary artists, such as Toulouse-Lautrec, Monet and Picasso, photographs, engravings and posters, together with some archive film, accompanied by the music of Debussy, Satie, Chambrier, Stravinsky, and a variety of contemporary quotes and observations.
